Theater phantasms are amalgamations of the spiritual and emotional energy given up by entertainers and audiences of powerful performances. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 37 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 [Theater Phantasm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2367) **Source** [Pathfinder #185: A Taste of Ashes](/Sources.aspx?ID=188) pg. 89 **Perception** +32; [all-around vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=1), [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21) 100 feet, [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) 100 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); up to four others **Skills** [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +30, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +35, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +30, [Theater Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +36 **Str** -5 **Dex** +4 **Con** +6 **Int** +2 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +9 **Bonded Theater** A theater phantasm can't travel more than 50 feet from the theater (or similar location) where it was created. --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +28 **Ref** +25 **Will** +30 **HP** 260 (emotional consumption, dramatic return, [negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** all 10 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297), or [positive^](/Traits.aspx?ID=128) double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)) **Catharsis** ([emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) When a theater phantasm is destroyed, it emits waves of emotional energy. All creatures within 50 feet take 10d6 mental damage (DC 34 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save) as they experience a crushing barrage of emotions.
**Dramatic Return** ([necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) A destroyed theater phantasm slowly reforms to full strength over the course of 1 week. The only way to permanently destroy the phantasm is to reduce it to 0 Hit Points during a performance occurring in its bonded theater.
**Emotional Consumption** ([emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) If a theater phantasm is within 100 feet of an audience of 20 or more intelligent beings witnessing a performance in its bonded theater, it gains [fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15) 20. --- **Speed** fly 40 feet **Melee** spectral hand +30 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 3d10+15 negative **Ranged** impromptu props +28 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 3d12+18 bludgeoning **Spotlight** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The theater phantasm draws attention to a creature it admires. The phantasm designates a target other than itself within 50 feet with a subtle spotlight, giving the target a +2 status bonus to [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) checks and resistance 10 to mental damage for 1 minute. If it uses this ability again on a new target, the former creature loses its spotlight.
Competing Phantasms On very rare occasions, more than one theater phantasm takes up residence in the same theater, each trying to outdo the other.
